alert.note: Alert for Fluvanna (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 1:39PM EDT until July 09 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Fluvanna County in central Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 139 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Palmyra, Lake Monticello, Troy, Cunningham, Central Plains, Nahor, Wildwood, Union Mills, Carysbrook, Cohasset, Wilmington, Antioch, Bybee, Shores, Zion Crossroads and Hardware. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
